definition: to wait/to inquire after/to watch/season/climate/(old) period of five days

sentences.chinese: 維持一份難伺候的人際關係。

sentences.english: You shouldn’t be waiting on me like this.
sentences.chinese: 你不應該這樣殷勤地伺候我。

sentences.english: Don't feel like entertaining 45 kids at your daughters birthday party?
sentences.chinese: 不喜歡在女兒生日派對上伺候45個孩子嗎？

sentences.english: She bustled about trying to wait on two customers at once.
sentences.chinese: 她到處奔忙，極力同時伺候兩位顧客。

sentences.english: Those in the Garden will be attended by immortal youths with wide, lovely eyes.
sentences.chinese: 樂園裏的這些人將由永遠青春的大眼美人兒伺候。

sentences.english: Then the devil left him, and angels came and attended him.
sentences.chinese: 於是魔鬼離了耶穌，有天使來伺候他。

sentences.english: Your highness, I am always in the Central Palace serving the talent ladies.
sentences.chinese: 殿下，奴才一直在中宮伺候才人們。

sentences.english: But your assistant, Joshua son of Nun, will enter it.
sentences.chinese: 伺候你，嫩的兒子約書亞，他必得進入那地。

sentences.english: Cosette was her only servant; a mouse in the service of an elephant.
sentences.chinese: 她唯一的僕人就是珂賽特，一隻伺候大象的小鼠。

sentences.english: Virgins await those who enter paradise.
sentences.chinese: 處女伺候進入天堂的人。

sentences.english: Female companions await those who enter the Gardens of Eden on the Day of Reckoning.
sentences.chinese: 在最後審判日，女性伴侶伺候那些進入伊甸園的人。
真的嗎？你的女朋友真難伺候。

sentences.english: WIDOW who was fond of cleaning had two little maidens to wait on her.
sentences.chinese: 有個有潔癖的寡婦，僱傭了兩個女僕來伺候她。

sentences.english: As long for diligently waiting above, the madam's in the mind bright hall can't diverge to us very.
sentences.chinese: 只要用心伺候，夫人心裏亮堂的很，不會對我們差的。

sentences.english: The maidservant valeted my mother very well.
sentences.chinese: 女僕伺候我母親極爲周到。

sentences.english: So here he was, cock of the walk, with two women to minister to his needs.
sentences.chinese: 父親那時就像是個土皇帝，有兩個女人伺候他。

definition: to attend to/to care for (patients etc)/to look after/to wait upon/to serve/also written 伏侍, see also 服事[fu2 shi4]
to order sb about/to use sb
to tend/to take care of sb
to take care of/to show consideration/to attend to/to look after
to order (sb) around/to send on an errand/to order away
to call to come and shout to go (idiom); to yell orders/always bossing people around
Master (term used by servant)/Your Majesty/operator (of machine)
